text:
I’m super excited to bring to you a 
lesson you requested with one of the

best series for English learners: Anne with an E.
This is a teenage family-friendly show based on a

well-known children’s book by Canadian author 
L.M. Montgomery called Anne of Green Gables.

You can learn lots of great vocabulary 
just by reading the titles of the episodes!

So, if you plan to sit an exam or are looking 
for something to enrich your vocabulary,

this is the show for you!
Just like this learner who

improved their skills and got 
an 8.5 band on the IELTS exam!

Besides that, we also help you understand 
your favorite TV series and movies

without getting lost, without missing 
the jokes, and without subtitles!

It’s incredible how Friends manages to use 
vocabulary in a way that is natural and fun, isn't

it? That's why we created a course for English 
learners entirely based on the sitcom, so you

can learn and practice expressions, pronunciation, 
and also learn about culture while having fun. Try

it now for FREE with our three-part masterclass. 
Just click up here or the link in the description.

Now before watching the scene without 
subtitles and taking a quiz on it,

don't forget to subscribe so you don't miss any 
of our lessons. I understand that memorizing new

vocabulary can be quite challenging, so here's a 
lesson we created with 14 fun activities beginner,

intermediate, and advanced learners 
can do to learn new words every day.
